item.title: Experiment #2: Truss Solver
item.description: A 2d truss solver. Controls: Click on nodes to select Click and drag to move nodes With a node selected click on other nodes to toggle connection. Click on trash with a node selected to delete it Double-Click on a node to begin forcing it. Click again to create a force in that direction with magnitude proportional to the distance between the node and click.

item.title: Experiment #1: Graphs
item.description: In mathematics, and more specifically in graph theory, a graph is a structure amounting to a set of objects in which some pairs of the objects are in some sense "related". The objects correspond to mathematical abstractions called vertices and each of the related pairs of vertices is called an edge. Typically, a graph is depicted in diagrammatic form as a set of dots or circles for the vertices, joined by lines or curves for the edges.
